reports.medicalNote: Patient is a 57-year-old male with adenocarcinoma and stomach cancer. He has a gastrotomy/PEG tube and has finished chemotherapy. The patient has a past medical history of BPH and reports neuropathy in bilateral hands and feet, a side effect of his chemotherapy medication. The therapist educated the patient on sensory techniques, fine motor activities, resistive putty exercises, and active hand exercises with written handouts. The patient is independent with his ADLs and was educated on compensatory strategies and energy conservation techniques due to reported fatigue. The therapist reviewed the importance of calling a nurse first for non-emergent situations, and the patient verbalized understanding. The patient declined further OT services at this time but was encouraged to contact OT with any questions or recommendations for equipment.

Therapist educated patient on sensory techniques, fine motor activities, resistive putty exercises, and active hand exercises with written handouts. Patient provided good teachback. The therapist also educated the patient on compensatory strategies and energy conservation techniques due to reported fatigue. Patient declined further OT services at this time.
